KH.content: “according to Hegel…and we are thinking after Hegel and according to him, following his thought” [philosophy only becomes serious after sublating mythic form, i.e. when it becomes logical]
KH.linkedContent: “according to Hegel…and we are thinking after Hegel and according to him, following his thought” [philosophy only becomes serious after sublating mythic form, i.e. when it becomes logical]

KH.content: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]
KH.linkedContent: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]

GOD.content: has Christianity alone made possible an authentic responsibility, responsibility as history, and as history of Europe? there’s no choice here btwn a logical deduction & reference to the revelatory event [not simply affirmed as believer]
GOD.linkedContent: has Christianity alone made possible an authentic responsibility, responsibility as history, and as history of Europe? there’s no choice here btwn a logical deduction & reference to the revelatory event [not simply affirmed as believer]

GT.content: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle
GT.linkedContent: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle

GT.content: et nous ne pouvons pas faire autrement que partir des textes, et des textes en tant qu’ils partent (qu’ils se séparent, d’eux-mêmes et de leur origine, de nous) dès le départ [even if we wished to]
GT.linkedContent: et nous ne pouvons pas faire autrement que partir des textes, et des textes en tant qu’ils partent (qu’ils se séparent, d’eux-mêmes et de leur origine, de nous) dès le départ [even if we wished to]

FK.content: impossible to deny the possibility of deconstruction [the opening of clôture]
FK.linkedContent: impossible to deny the possibility of deconstruction [the opening of clôture]

MONL.content: cannot challenge indisputable monolingualism in me, except by testifying to its omnipresence in me
MONL.linkedContent: cannot challenge indisputable monolingualism in me, except by testifying to its omnipresence in me

OOG.content: [quoted from “Form and Meaning”] no choice [undecidable] btwn 2 lines of thought but to reflect on circularity that makes one pass into the other, by repeating the circle, an elliptical change of site, producing a non-negative deficiency as ellipsis of form and meaning
OOG.linkedContent: [quoted from “Form and Meaning”] no choice [undecidable] btwn 2 lines of thought but to reflect on circularity that makes one pass into the other, by repeating the circle, an elliptical change of site, producing a non-negative deficiency as ellipsis of form and meaning

FL.content: [re: questions concerning deconstruction & justice] cannot answer “either/or,” “yes or no”
FL.linkedContent: [re: questions concerning deconstruction & justice] cannot answer “either/or,” “yes or no”

MC.content: pitting one fiction against the other (mania vs. Freud), do we really have a choice?
MC.linkedContent: pitting one fiction against the other (mania vs. Freud), do we really have a choice?

SPOM.content: is a day infinitely foreign to vengeance [w/out it], heterogeneous at its source, to come or more ancient than memory itself? impossible to decide, today: “the time is out of joint”
SPOM.linkedContent: is a day infinitely foreign to vengeance [w/out it], heterogeneous at its source, to come or more ancient than memory itself? impossible to decide, today: “the time is out of joint”

POOF.content: if there’s a single thesis [in POOF], it’s that there’s no choice [no choice of double gesture]: 1) the political is phallogocentrism, virtue is virile, thus woman’s slow/painful access to citizenship: we must go beyond the political 2) keep the ‘old name’ & engage other struggles, ‘partisan’ ones
POOF.linkedContent: if there’s a single thesis [in POOF], it’s that there’s no choice [no choice of double gesture]: 1) the political is phallogocentrism, virtue is virile, thus woman’s slow/painful access to citizenship: we must go beyond the political 2) keep the ‘old name’ & engage other struggles, ‘partisan’ ones

POOF.content: de-naturalization of fraternal authority (its de-construction), preference given to democratic fraternization > this is all possible, along w/ demand of a democracy to-come, because fraternity was never natural, never a fact [God is dead because God was always dead?]
POOF.linkedContent: de-naturalization of fraternal authority (its de-construction), preference given to democratic fraternization > this is all possible, along w/ demand of a democracy to-come, because fraternity was never natural, never a fact [God is dead because God was always dead?]

POO.content: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?
POO.linkedContent: the duplicity before the rule makes one tremble, an other who will seek to hold you back or push you into void, save you or lose you, supposing there ever a choice?

POO.content: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]
POO.linkedContent: impossible to respond, impossible not to respond, double bind, 2 hands nailed down [no choice]

POO.content: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders
POO.linkedContent: brought to a halt [arrêt?] when faced w/ contradictory orders

MSUBJ.content: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable
MSUBJ.linkedContent: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable

MPM.content: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken > in trace, part greater/less than whole
MPM.linkedContent: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken > in trace, part greater/less than whole

A.content: we Marrano’s waiting each other with a secret we haven’t chosen
A.linkedContent: we Marrano’s waiting each other with a secret we haven’t chosen

VM.content: community of question has an unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, because the impossible already happened [totality of beings, history of facts, etc.]
VM.linkedContent: community of question has an unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, because the impossible already happened [totality of beings, history of facts, etc.]

VM.content: that we are consigned to Greek element, a knowledge and confidence that is not comfortable, that torments us
VM.linkedContent: that we are consigned to Greek element, a knowledge and confidence that is not comfortable, that torments us

VM.content: Heidegger says our thought has been desiccated, its return to Greek source, thought of Being, is a knowledge, security not in the world, possibility of our language & nexus of our world
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger says our thought has been desiccated, its return to Greek source, thought of Being, is a knowledge, security not in the world, possibility of our language & nexus of our world

VM.content: we will not choose btwn the opening and the totality, we will be incoherent, w/out systematically resigning to incoherence
VM.linkedContent: we will not choose btwn the opening and the totality, we will be incoherent, w/out systematically resigning to incoherence

VM.content: why does Levinas return to categories he rejected? Derrida’s not denouncing incoherence [w/ this question], he’s wondering about meaning of necessity, necessity of lodging oneself w/in traditional conceptuality in order to destroy it—does this imposed necessity cache-t-elle quelque ressource indestructible et imprévisible du logos grec? quelque puissance illimitée d’enveloppement dans laquelle celui qui voudrait le repousser serait toujours déjà surpris?
VM.linkedContent: why does Levinas return to categories he rejected? Derrida’s not denouncing incoherence [w/ this question], he’s wondering about meaning of necessity, necessity of lodging oneself w/in traditional conceptuality in order to destroy it—does this imposed necessity cache-t-elle quelque ressource indestructible et imprévisible du logos grec? quelque puissance illimitée d’enveloppement dans laquelle celui qui voudrait le repousser serait toujours déjà surpris?

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

VM.content: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself
VM.linkedContent: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself

VM.content: avoid the worst by vigilance that takes finitude (history) seriously: that fights light w/ light: philosopher must speak and write w/in this war of light, in which he knows he’s already engaged; the worst is night, which precedes or represses discourse
VM.linkedContent: avoid the worst by vigilance that takes finitude (history) seriously: that fights light w/ light: philosopher must speak and write w/in this war of light, in which he knows he’s already engaged; the worst is night, which precedes or represses discourse

VM.content: an economy of violence (economy irreducible to Levinas’ definition) that tolerates neither finite totality, nor positive infinity
VM.linkedContent: an economy of violence (economy irreducible to Levinas’ definition) that tolerates neither finite totality, nor positive infinity

OH.content: we did not choose this responsibility of our heritage [it is from the other, the language of our language], nor the capitalizing memory we have of it
OH.linkedContent: we did not choose this responsibility of our heritage [it is from the other, the language of our language], nor the capitalizing memory we have of it

VP.content: w/in the metaphysics of presence, we believe in absolute knowledge as closure or the end of history, it has taken place, consciousness of self in infinity of parousia, this history’s closed
VP.linkedContent: w/in the metaphysics of presence, we believe in absolute knowledge as closure or the end of history, it has taken place, consciousness of self in infinity of parousia, this history’s closed

PAS.content: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept
PAS.linkedContent: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept

S.content: only choice is btwn the terrifying contaminations it assigns [re: subjectity of spirit]
S.linkedContent: only choice is btwn the terrifying contaminations it assigns [re: subjectity of spirit]

SH.content: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]
SH.linkedContent: cipher can conceal secret, which it shelters in its readability, w/out the slightest hidden attention > there’s nothing it can do about it [why/who interpret(s) secret as a taunting gesture?]

SH.content: via Celan, date/poem becoming no one’s, this possessive has 2 meanings that form a tragic alliance: 1) either date remains encrypted, finite survival, the survivors (readers, interpreters, guardians) of poem lose possession of it in spectral return 2) or nothing is encrypted, poem available to all, the other’s singularity is incinerated > there is no choice btwn this either/or, no contradiction, the madness, sense, chance of a poem
SH.linkedContent: via Celan, date/poem becoming no one’s, this possessive has 2 meanings that form a tragic alliance: 1) either date remains encrypted, finite survival, the survivors (readers, interpreters, guardians) of poem lose possession of it in spectral return 2) or nothing is encrypted, poem available to all, the other’s singularity is incinerated > there is no choice btwn this either/or, no contradiction, the madness, sense, chance of a poem

FWT.content: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us
FWT.linkedContent: we do not choose our inheritance, it violently elects us

FWT.content: contradictory tasks set to us by inheritance: testimony to our finitude, which obliges us to inherit older, more powerful, more durable, and same finitude obliges one to choose, select, sacrifice, exclude
FWT.linkedContent: contradictory tasks set to us by inheritance: testimony to our finitude, which obliges us to inherit older, more powerful, more durable, and same finitude obliges one to choose, select, sacrifice, exclude

FWT.content: event worthy of the name absolutely surprises me, so I can’t not respond, exposed beyond all mastery, dare I say, happily vulnerable
FWT.linkedContent: event worthy of the name absolutely surprises me, so I can’t not respond, exposed beyond all mastery, dare I say, happily vulnerable

OS.content: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger designates milieu of self-evidence, outside which thought suffocates > has not entire philosophy been authorized on “extraordinary right” of present? for Heidegger, it’s not a question of thinking otherwise, it’s thinking that which could not have been, nor thought, otherwise ——the impossibility of the otherwise produces a trembling, a question of tout autre, think the tie btwn truth/presence, in a thought that doesn’t need to be true/present [no skeptical moment]

OS.content: “there is no chance that within the thematic of metaphysics anything might have budged” w/ respect to concept of time, from Aristotle to Hegel > founding concepts, entire system, substance, cause, etc. sufficed > one cannot interrupt, transgress, exceed “metaphysics” w/out acknowledging this powerful systematic truth
OS.linkedContent: “there is no chance that within the thematic of metaphysics anything might have budged” w/ respect to concept of time, from Aristotle to Hegel > founding concepts, entire system, substance, cause, etc. sufficed > one cannot interrupt, transgress, exceed “metaphysics” w/out acknowledging this powerful systematic truth

OS.content: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]
OS.linkedContent: must think play of submission & subtraction as formal rule to read history of metaphysics w/in opening of Heidegger’s breakthrough [re: categories such as desire, movement, time]

POS.content: Derrida’s texts are entirely consumed by reading of other ones, and also only its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s texts are entirely consumed by reading of other ones, and also only its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]

POS.content: to become attuned to a difference beyond that btwn Being and beings is not possible today, but we can show how it is in preparation
POS.linkedContent: to become attuned to a difference beyond that btwn Being and beings is not possible today, but we can show how it is in preparation

OTO.content: we will not decide through hermeneutic, exegetic interpretations, but will offer political interventions which politically rewrite the text and its destination: this is how it’s been since Hegel, the destinational structure of all post-Hegelian texts: Heideggerian left, Heideggerian right, Marxism left, Marxism right > the one can always be the double of the other
OTO.linkedContent: we will not decide through hermeneutic, exegetic interpretations, but will offer political interventions which politically rewrite the text and its destination: this is how it’s been since Hegel, the destinational structure of all post-Hegelian texts: Heideggerian left, Heideggerian right, Marxism left, Marxism right > the one can always be the double of the other

ATIA.content: to think the war we find ourselves waging [against animals] is not only a duty, no one can escape it: thinking, perhaps, begins when animal looks at us and we are naked before it
ATIA.linkedContent: to think the war we find ourselves waging [against animals] is not only a duty, no one can escape it: thinking, perhaps, begins when animal looks at us and we are naked before it

GSP.content: risk betraying philosophy by imposing a debate, a choice on it: “genesis & structure”
GSP.linkedContent: risk betraying philosophy by imposing a debate, a choice on it: “genesis & structure”

GSP.content: faithful comprehension [“true positivism”] of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)
GSP.linkedContent: faithful comprehension [“true positivism”] of phenomenologist dispels shadow of a choice (might even say Husserl attuned to historicity of meaning, possibility of its becoming)

GSP.content: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]
GSP.linkedContent: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]

PS.content: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort
PS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort

PS.content: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference
PS.linkedContent: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference

PS.content: we could not avoid the violence of the example the moment we proscribed it, but perhaps we can better understand the necessity of this incoherence
PS.linkedContent: we could not avoid the violence of the example the moment we proscribed it, but perhaps we can better understand the necessity of this incoherence

FS.content: our discourse irreducibly belongs to system of metaphysical oppositions
FS.linkedContent: our discourse irreducibly belongs to system of metaphysical oppositions

FS.content: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]
FS.linkedContent: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]

CHM.content: [Derrida asks question about Foucault’s responsibility, the manner in which Foucault seems to return to innocence, end all complicity] doesn’t suffice to imprison the delegate, the psychiatrist, and in doing so the whole adventure of Western reason (acc. Foucault, capture & objectification of madness): wouldn’t Foucault’s proceedings, verdict, reiterate the crime?
CHM.linkedContent: [Derrida asks question about Foucault’s responsibility, the manner in which Foucault seems to return to innocence, end all complicity] doesn’t suffice to imprison the delegate, the psychiatrist, and in doing so the whole adventure of Western reason (acc. Foucault, capture & objectification of madness): wouldn’t Foucault’s proceedings, verdict, reiterate the crime?

CHM.content: if the Order is as powerful as Foucault says it is: infinite, universal complicity of those who understand “this language”
CHM.linkedContent: if the Order is as powerful as Foucault says it is: infinite, universal complicity of those who understand “this language”

CHM.content: unsurpassable, unique, imperial grandeur of order of reason (Hegelian law) leaves us only recourse to strategies and strategies
CHM.linkedContent: unsurpassable, unique, imperial grandeur of order of reason (Hegelian law) leaves us only recourse to strategies and strategies

CHM.content: archaeology against reason can’t be written: concept of “history” has always been a rational one > writing that exceeds, by questioning them, values of “origin,” “reason,” “history” couldn’t be contained w/in metaphysical closure of an archaeology
CHM.linkedContent: archaeology against reason can’t be written: concept of “history” has always been a rational one > writing that exceeds, by questioning them, values of “origin,” “reason,” “history” couldn’t be contained w/in metaphysical closure of an archaeology

RGE.content: there’s only one discourse, it is significative, no getting around Hegel here
RGE.linkedContent: there’s only one discourse, it is significative, no getting around Hegel here

REST.content: [re: les question de la démarche embarrassée (boîteuse ou louche?)] i.e. “Who is walking?” “On whose feet?” > idiomatic figures of questions seem necessary; “necessary: it’s an attribute,” still vague > better to say question-idioms the form of which is very fitting, clinging (collant) (tightly/flexibly) to figure or body of what you here wish to turn into an object (feet)
REST.linkedContent: [re: les question de la démarche embarrassée (boîteuse ou louche?)] i.e. “Who is walking?” “On whose feet?” > idiomatic figures of questions seem necessary; “necessary: it’s an attribute,” still vague > better to say question-idioms the form of which is very fitting, clinging (collant) (tightly/flexibly) to figure or body of what you here wish to turn into an object (feet)

REST.content: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)
REST.linkedContent: if police there is (and isn’t there always?) > Derrida polices too [?], “close reading,” counterpolices [?] oldest, most dogmatic, sinisterly authoritarian programs, massive meidatizing machines: pre-text of perception, of bare hands (mains nue), of real history, of living speech (vous enferme en tout hâte dans un prétendu hors-texte)

REST.content: as in fetishism trial, everything is a business & economy of detail, of la détaille (de-tailing/unsizing), you can’t do w/out detail
REST.linkedContent: as in fetishism trial, everything is a business & economy of detail, of la détaille (de-tailing/unsizing), you can’t do w/out detail

REST.content: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)] [can’t tell the difference btwn imperative & no choice]
REST.linkedContent: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)] [can’t tell the difference btwn imperative & no choice]

RM.content: Derrida’s “disconcerting (déroutante) tactic” to use usure doubly, not wily, manipulative or triumphant perversity: “corresponds to intractable structure in which we are limited & carried away in advance”
RM.linkedContent: Derrida’s “disconcerting (déroutante) tactic” to use usure doubly, not wily, manipulative or triumphant perversity: “corresponds to intractable structure in which we are limited & carried away in advance”

WAP.content: must struggle w/ (s’archaner) and submit to Kantian tradition, & critique/overvalue its “object,” reinstitute it by deconstructing its genealogy
WAP.linkedContent: must struggle w/ (s’archaner) and submit to Kantian tradition, & critique/overvalue its “object,” reinstitute it by deconstructing its genealogy

WAP.content: le présent discours [Derrida’s] ne saurait échapper totalement à la loi de cet espace [Kant’s], même s'il tente au moins de laisser filtrer une autre lueur (another glimmer), ou plus précisément de se laisser infiltrer (let itself be infiltrated) par une lueur qui déjà vient d'ailleurs et passe par tant de lézardes (so many cracks)
WAP.linkedContent: le présent discours [Derrida’s] ne saurait échapper totalement à la loi de cet espace [Kant’s], même s'il tente au moins de laisser filtrer une autre lueur (another glimmer), ou plus précisément de se laisser infiltrer (let itself be infiltrated) par une lueur qui déjà vient d'ailleurs et passe par tant de lézardes (so many cracks)

WAP.content: not neutral, every institution calls for or at least implies a taking sides (prise de parti)
WAP.linkedContent: not neutral, every institution calls for or at least implies a taking sides (prise de parti)

WAP.content: il n’y a pas le choix, a political theme: every monolingualism restores mastery
WAP.linkedContent: il n’y a pas le choix, a political theme: every monolingualism restores mastery

WAP.content: unity of language always vested and manipulated simulacrum, a positivist dogma and, à la fois, a phenomenon that can be found nowhere > so: play, graft between languages, w/in the languages in language, thus we can struggle against colonizing principle
WAP.linkedContent: unity of language always vested and manipulated simulacrum, a positivist dogma and, à la fois, a phenomenon that can be found nowhere > so: play, graft between languages, w/in the languages in language, thus we can struggle against colonizing principle

EJQB.content: Jabes: “what difference is there btwn choosing and being chosen when we can do nothing but submit to the choice?”
EJQB.linkedContent: Jabes: “what difference is there btwn choosing and being chosen when we can do nothing but submit to the choice?”

D.content: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte
D.linkedContent: Soller’s Numbers is exemplary re: the reader, cette fois enfin, the text shows (montrée) that a reader cannot choose his/her place in a text > does so by composing surfaces retournées & par une mise en scène matérielle exacte

D.content: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec
D.linkedContent: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec

LI.content: [vis-à-vis iterability altering, contaminating] no choice but to mean to say something other than what we mean to say: accident is never an accident
LI.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis iterability altering, contaminating] no choice but to mean to say something other than what we mean to say: accident is never an accident

LI.content: differance, iterability—not entirely words or concepts, must take classical discourse into account, accept logic of “all or nothing” > when one no longer does (via differance, mark, supplement…), must rigorously, pedagogically, explain why one changes the rules
LI.linkedContent: differance, iterability—not entirely words or concepts, must take classical discourse into account, accept logic of “all or nothing” > when one no longer does (via differance, mark, supplement…), must rigorously, pedagogically, explain why one changes the rules

TN.content: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
TN.linkedContent: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world

OG.content: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided
OG.linkedContent: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided

OG.content: to think play radically must follow Husserl and Heidegger to the end, conserve legibility of their thought, must know le jeu du monde before attempting to understand all forms of play in the world > play, as absence of transcendental signified, not a play in the world
OG.linkedContent: to think play radically must follow Husserl and Heidegger to the end, conserve legibility of their thought, must know le jeu du monde before attempting to understand all forms of play in the world > play, as absence of transcendental signified, not a play in the world

OG.content: that nonpresentation is as “originary” as presentation for Husserl is why thought of trace can no more break w/ than be reduced to transcendental phenomenology: no choice (choix) here, to make it seem like there is, is to confuse very different levels, paths, styles
OG.linkedContent: that nonpresentation is as “originary” as presentation for Husserl is why thought of trace can no more break w/ than be reduced to transcendental phenomenology: no choice (choix) here, to make it seem like there is, is to confuse very different levels, paths, styles

OG.content: in the deconstruction of arche, one doesn’t proceed by choice (élection)
OG.linkedContent: in the deconstruction of arche, one doesn’t proceed by choice (élection)

OG.content: one can only justify the choice of word trace w/in une topique, it’s an historical calculation & strategy: a # of givens belonging to our discourse have imposed this choice on Derrida > Levinas—trace as absolute past, Heidegger—undermining ontology as presence/full speech, Nietzsche & Freud—Spur, and use of [trace?] in biology > all make enigmatic: propre, proche, presence

ATAP.content: every apocalyptic eschatology promised in name of light, we are heirs to these Lumières, cannot & must not forgo the Aufklärung; must keep enough apocalyptic desire (clarity, revelation) to deconstruct apocalyptic discourse
ATAP.linkedContent: every apocalyptic eschatology promised in name of light, we are heirs to these Lumières, cannot & must not forgo the Aufklärung; must keep enough apocalyptic desire (clarity, revelation) to deconstruct apocalyptic discourse

EU.content: response: initial form & minimal requirement of responsibility > structure of call to responsibility so anterior to any positive response—nonresponse a priori assumes responsibility
EU.linkedContent: response: initial form & minimal requirement of responsibility > structure of call to responsibility so anterior to any positive response—nonresponse a priori assumes responsibility
